root.data: Goal 16. Promote the emergence of peaceful and inclusive societies for sustainable development, ensure access to justice for all and build, at all levels, effective, accountable and inclusive institutions16.1 Significantly reduce all forms of violence and associated death rates everywhere16.1.4 Number of people who consider it safe to walk alone in their area of residence, as a proportion of the total populationISTEEBUNDAYISENGA ModestESSSP department manager79401937ndayimode2010@gmail.comThis is the percentage of the population considering that there is no danger in walking alone in their area of residence during the day.%Household surveysData are collected from household surveys using the "household" questionnaireThe probable date of the next collection will be 20212022ISTEEBUISTEEBUISTEEBU is the central body recognized by the Burundian government for the collection, processing and dissemination of official statistics helping in planning and decision-making.The indicator is relevant because it reflects safetyUpdating the indicator requires a household survey which is very resource intensive. The indicator cannot be calculated by gender.Ratio between the population considering that there is no danger in walking alone in their area of residence and the total population, expressed as a percentageValidation is done at national levelAvailable at national level, gender and Place of residence (National; Male; Female; Urban; Rural)The indicator can be compared to other indicators of the same type at regional and international levelReport of the Survey on Household Living Conditions in Burundi 2013
